title.rendered: President Claudia Sheinbaum Holds First Press Briefing Following US Elections

caption.rendered: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico’s president, speaks during a news conference at the National Palace in Mexico City, Mexico, on Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2024. Mexicans should remain calm in the wake of Donald Trump’s decisive election win, the president of the US’s largest trading partner and southern neighbor said, sounding a note of pragmatism as local markets began to recover from their initial shock. Photographer: Stephania Corpi/Bloomberg via Getty Images

image_meta.caption: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico's president, speaks during a news conference at the National Palace in Mexico City, Mexico, on Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2024. Mexicans should remain calm in the wake of Donald Trump's decisive election win, the president of the US's largest trading partner and southern neighbor said, sounding a note of pragmatism as local markets began to recover from their initial shock. Photographer: Stephania Corpi/Bloomberg via Getty Images
image_meta.title: President Claudia Sheinbaum Holds First Press Briefing Following US Elections

title.rendered: Internally displaced Palestinian families in Al Zaitun neighbourhood of Gaza City

caption.rendered: Foto EFE

image_meta.caption: AL ZAITUN NEIGHBOURHOOD EAST GAZ (---), 12/12/2025.- Tents of internally displaced Palestinian families seen among the ruins of destroyed buildings in Al Zaitun neighbourhood during a rainy day in the east of Gaza City on, 12 December 2025, amid a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas. According to the UN around 90 percent of the population or 1.9 million people in Gaza have been displaced since the start of the conflict. EFE/EPA/MOHAMMED SABER
image_meta.title: Internally displaced Palestinian families in Al Zaitun neighbourhood of Gaza City
